decks.notes: The main theme of this deck is centered around using control elements to manipulate the battlefield and outlast opponents. By utilizing cards like Abandon Attachments, Combustion Technique, and Artist's Talent, the player can effectively control the pace of the game and disrupt their opponent's strategies. With a mix of card draw, removal spells, and counterspells, the Izzet Control deck aims to establish board presence and maintain control of the game until they can secure victory.

This aggressive Dimir deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures and using disruptive spells to control the board while pushing damage through. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and disruption, using cards like Floodpits Drowner and Spyglass Siren to pressure the opponent while maintaining control with counterspells and removal spells like Heartless Act and Tragic Trajectory. Utilizing card advantage and tempo is crucial for this deck to outpace opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with efficient creatures and utilizing cards like Bloodghast and Festering Gulch to maintain pressure on the opponent. The key strategy is to create a fast aggro deck that can overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early game aggression and late game resilience. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Umbral Collar Zealot, this deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to focus on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, countermagic, and powerful creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Day of Judgment to clear the board, Stock Up and Consult the Star Charts to draw cards and find answers, and Beza, the Bounding Spring and Marang River Regent as win conditions. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and strong finishers, this UW Control deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out victories through careful play and resource management.

The main focus of this Izzet Control deck is to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategy using a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and tempo while setting up powerful late game plays. Key cards like Firebending Lesson and Artist's Talent help to control the board, while Accumulate Wisdom and Multiversal Passage provide card advantage. The deck also includes win conditions like Boomerang Basics and Monument to Endurance to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The focus of this deck is to control the board and opponent's resources using a combination of instants, sorceries, and other spells. The deck emphasizes card advantage and removal spells to maintain control of the game. It features a mix of direct damage spells and counter spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also providing card draw and additional resources to outlast the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes some powerful finisher spells to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through card draw, counterspells, and removal while utilizing land cards to generate mana efficiently. The key strategy is to maintain board control and card advantage through a combination of removal spells like Lightning Helix, counterspells like No More Lies, and card draw effects like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Jeskai Revelation to close out games once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to slow down and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and prison effects. Cards like Authority of the Consuls and Cryogen Relic help control the board, while Simulacrum Synthesizer and Temple of Enlightenment provide card advantage. Multiversal Passage and Repurposing Bay offer mana fixing and card selection. Pinnacle Starcage and Demolition Field provide additional protection, and Split Up allows for card advantage. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, outvalue the opponent, and ultimately win through attrition.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence with efficient creatures and ramp spells like Llanowar Elves, Fabled Passage, and Hushwood Verge. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo by playing powerful threats like Colossal Rattlewurm and Sazh's Chocobo while using cards like Earthbender Ascension and Seam Rip to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards for additional utility and card advantage, such as Esper Origins and Get Lost. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with fast, resilient creatures and efficient spell choices.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Callous Sell-Sword and Emberheart Challenger, while also utilizing powerful spells like Dreadmaw's Ire and Turn Inside Out to further push damage through. Leyline of Resonance helps to maintain pressure on the opponent, while cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Bulk Up provide additional support and utility. The deck also includes some versatile creatures like Firebending Student and Kellan, Planar Trailblazer, along with cards like Full Bore and Stadium Headliner for added firepower. The overall strategy is to maintain a fast pace and keep the pressure on the opponent until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on card advantage and control through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw effects. By utilizing cards like Consult the Star Charts, Stock Up, Meticulous Archive, and Jeskai Revelation, the player can draw through their deck, find answers to threats, and maintain a strong hand. Removal spells such as Lightning Helix, Day of Judgment, and Abrade help control the board, while counterspells like Get Lost and No More Lies can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes some additional utility lands and a few win conditions in Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Marang River Regent.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to manipulate and control the game through card draw, counterspells, and removal spells. The deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan and respond to threats efficiently. Cards like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive help with card advantage, while counterspells like Annul and removal spells like Day of Judgment and No More Lies deal with opposing threats. Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Jeskai Revelation provide additional card advantage, while cards like Stock Up and Split Up help with deck manipulation. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent to secure a victory.

The focus of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Burnout Bashtronaut and Nova Hellkite, combined with versatile burn spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that pressure to finish them off before they can stabilize. The deck also includes some control elements like Shock and Tersa Lightshatter to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Bant Airbending cards in combination with powerful creatures and spells to create a versatile and synergistic combo strategy. By using cards like Aang, Swift Savior and Airbender Ascension, along with support cards like Doc Aurlock and Multiversal Passage, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with efficient plays and resource management. The deck also contains key finishers like Voice of Victory and Werefox Bodyguard to secure the win once the combo has been set up.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures while also disrupting their game plan. The deck includes powerful early game threats like Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid to put pressure on the opponent, supported by ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Multiversal Passage. Disruptive Stormbrood provides disruption against control decks, while cards like Scavenging Ooze and Insidious Roots help to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Awaken the Honored Dead and Bitter Triumph. The combo aspect comes from using cards like Bringer of the Last Gift to reanimate powerful creatures such as Terror of the Peaks and Ardyn, the Usurper. The deck also includes cards like Superior Spider-Man and Overlord of the Balemurk to help control the board and protect your reanimated creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of powerful creatures from the graveyard.
